bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition identical with gu ju 骨疽 , bone impediment-illness. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry shui she 水 蛇：小兒骨瘡：海上方詩云：小兒骨痛不堪言，出血流膿實可憐 , “ Bone sores among children: A poem in the Hai shang fang states: The pain in the bones of children is undescribable; blood flow and putrescence are truly pitiable”. Gu dan 穀疸 , grain dan -illness [8]

Alternative Names gu huang 穀黃 , grain jaundice; shi huang 食 黃 , food jaundice Pathological Condition of huang dan 黃疸 , yellow dan -illness, resulting from a consumption of inappropriate beverages and food. Jin gui yao lue 金匱要略 Mj: 穀氣不消，胃中苦濁…身體盡 黃，名曰穀疸 , “The qi of grain is not dissolved and there is a turbidity in the stomach. ...The entire body is yellow. This is called ‘ grain dan -illness ’”.
